alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hart; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 12:57PM EDT until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Georgia, including the following counties, Franklin, Hart and Stephens. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1255 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated another series of heavy rain showers and embedded thunderstorms crossing the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the past hour, and this area received 1 to 3 inches of rain early this morning. Additional rainfall amounts up to an inch will be possible this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carnesville, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Bowersville, Martin, Avalon, Tugaloo State Park, Victoria Bryant State Park, Lake Hartwell and Eastanolee. Flooding is most likely along Crawford Creek, Shoal Creek, and tributaries to the Savannah River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
